summary: This document is a draft plea agreement between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida and Jeffrey Epstein, along with related email correspondence. The agreement outlines Epstein's guilty plea to two federal obstruction charges related to a conspiracy to solicit minors for prostitution, with a joint recommendation of 18 months imprisonment. The emails discuss negotiation details and the types of agreements possible.

persons.name: Jay Lefkowitz
persons.context: Recipient of emails from the Assistant U.S. Attorney discussing draft agreements and negotiation points for Epstein's case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual agreeing to plead guilty to a two-count Information for obstruction charges related to a conspiracy to solicit minors for prostitution and travel for illicit sexual conduct.

persons.name: R. Alexander Acosta
persons.context: The U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida who signed the plea agreement on behalf of the United States.

persons.name: Gerald Lefcourt
persons.context: Listed as the attorney for defendant Jeffrey Epstein, signing the plea agreement.

connections.description: Lefkowitz is communicating with the U.S. Attorney's office regarding draft plea agreements for Epstein, indicating he is acting as legal counsel.
Lefcourt is explicitly listed as the attorney for defendant Jeffrey Epstein on the plea agreement.
Acosta, as U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority entering into a plea agreement with defendant Epstein.

events.title: Conspiracy to Solicit Minors
events.description: Epstein's conduct, and the conduct of others, involved a conspiracy to solicit minors to engage in prostitution and to travel in interstate commerce to engage in illicit sexual conduct from early 2001 through September 2007.

events.title: Draft Plea Agreement Communication
events.description: Email correspondence between an Assistant U.S. Attorney and Jay Lefkowitz discussing draft agreements, stating the U.S. Attorney will not go below 18 months prison time.

events.title: Obstruction Incident
events.description: Reference to an incident where Mr. Epstein's private investigators followed a victim's father, forcing him off the road, considered for a potential second obstruction count.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: The plea agreement requires Jeffrey Epstein to plead guilty to two federal counts of obstruction (harassment to prevent testimony and reporting) related to a minor prostitution conspiracy.
The agreement includes a joint recommendation for an 18-month federal prison sentence, followed by supervised release and a fine.
Epstein also agreed to plead guilty to a state charge requiring sex offender registration and to a joint state sentencing recommendation of at least 18 months imprisonment.
The agreement suspends the federal grand jury investigation and resolves federal criminal liability for Epstein and any co-conspirators known to the U.S. Attorney's Office as of the agreement date.
The U.S. Attorney's office indicated they would not agree to a sentence below 18 months of prison/jail time for Epstein.
